result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody W Gillis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read in case for sentencing along with case no. 15-CF-57. Court dismisses case but will read in for sentencing in case 15-CF-57. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that matter is resolved, will be requesting that he be allowed to serve time in different county, need to work out logistics of transport from jail to job, requests plea hearing in 2-3 weeks.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cody W Gillis in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appoints Brett Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $40 per pay period via wage assignment.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody W Gillis in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court reviews Petition for Appointment of Counsel, appoints Atty Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $40 per pay period via wage assignment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to be in any bars or taverns. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Cody W Gillis appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/13/15, 10:00.
